title: Our Course Project
text:
I’m honored to be a member of the eneRgytics project team.
Below, you’ll find a brief summary of our project.


To access a detailed project description, please click here.

Summary
One of the main goals of the permanent daylight saving time application, which was implemented in 2016, was to save electricity. As shown by our analysis based on data from TURKSTAT, this application, used since 2016, indicates that no savings in electricity consumption were achieved until 2021. Moreover, as shown in the graphs, it can also be said that regions with a steady trend or a decreasing trend in electricity consumption experienced an increase.



 Back to top

title: Welcome to My Analytics Lab
text:
Hello! My name is Ahmet OCZAN..!
This is my personal webpage.
Please stay tuned to follow my works on data analytics, blog posts, and more.
This is our template.




 Back to top

title: Assignment 2
text:
Library Preparation


Create URL


Show code
url1 <- c("https://m.imdb.com/search/title/?title_type=feature&release_date=2010-01-01,&num_votes=2500,&country_of_origin=TR&count=250")
url2 <- "https://m.imdb.com/search/title/?title_type=feature&release_date=2010-01-01,2024-12-31&num_votes=2499,&country_of_origin=TR&count=250"




Show code
page1 <- read_html(url1)
page2 <- read_html(url2)




html_nodes and html_text


Show code
titles1 <- page1 |> html_nodes(".ipc-title__text") |> html_text()
titles2 <- page2 |> html_nodes(".ipc-title__text") |> html_text()
titles1 <- page1 |> html_nodes(".dli-title") |> html_text()
titles2 <- page2 |> html_nodes(".dli-title") |> html_text()


years1 <- page1 |> html_nodes(".dli-title-metadata-item:nth-child(1)") |> html_text()
years2 <- page2 |> html_nodes(".dli-title-metadata-item:nth-child(1)") |> html_text()


durations1 <- page1 |> html_nodes(".dli-title-metadata-item:nth-child(2)") |> html_text()
durations2 <- page2 |> html_nodes(".dli-title-metadata-item:nth-child(2)") |> html_text()


ratings1 <- page1 |> html_nodes(".ratingGroup--imdb-rating") |> html_text()
ratings2 <- page2 |> html_nodes(".ratingGroup--imdb-rating") |> html_text()


votes1 <- page1 |> html_nodes(".ipc-rating-star--voteCount") |> html_text()
votes2 <- page2 |> html_nodes(".ipc-rating-star--voteCount") |> html_text()

combined_titles <- c(titles1, titles2)
combined_years <- c(years1, years2)
combined_durations <- c(durations1, durations2)
combined_ratings <- c(ratings1, ratings2)
combined_votes <- c(votes1, votes2)




Outputs

Show code
title_names1 <- page1 |> html_nodes('.ipc-title__text')
title_names1 <- html_text(title_names1)
title_names1 <- tail(head(title_names1,-1),-1)
title_names1 <- str_split(title_names1, " ", n=2)
title_names1 <- unlist(lapply(title_names1, function(x) {x[2]}))

title_names2 <- page2 |> html_nodes('.ipc-title__text')
title_names2 <- html_text(title_names2)
title_names2 <- tail(head(title_names2,-1),-1)
title_names2 <- str_split(title_names2, " ", n=2)
title_names2 <- unlist(lapply(title_names2, function(x) {x[2]}))

combined_title_names <- c(title_names1, title_names2)
combined_title_names <- gsub("^[\\s]+|\\s+$", "", combined_title_names) # I got help from ChatGDP
Sys.setlocale("LC_ALL", "Turkish") # I got help from ChatGDP


[1] "LC_COLLATE=Turkish_Türkiye.1254;LC_CTYPE=Turkish_Türkiye.1254;LC_MONETARY=Turkish_Türkiye.1254;LC_NUMERIC=C;LC_TIME=Turkish_Türkiye.1254"




For Durations


Show code
hours1 <- as.integer(str_extract(durations1, "\\d+(?=h)"))  
minutes1 <- as.integer(str_extract(durations1, "\\d+(?=m)"))  

hours1[is.na(hours1)] <- as.integer("0")     
minutes1[is.na(minutes1)] <- as.integer("0") 


total_duration_minutes1 <- (hours1 * 60) + minutes1


hours2 <- as.integer(str_extract(durations2, "\\d+(?=h)"))
minutes2 <- as.integer(str_extract(durations2, "\\d+(?=m)"))

hours2[is.na(hours2)] <- as.integer("0")
minutes2[is.na(minutes2)] <- as.integer("0")

total_duration_minutes2 <- (hours2 * 60) + minutes2


combined_durations <- c(total_duration_minutes1 , total_duration_minutes2)
print(combined_durations)

[20]  79 106  90 140 114  85 197 132  97 196  95 125 157  88 107 188  91 135 129
[39] 134 136 113  96 117 107  79 106  90 140 114  85




For Votes


Show code
votes1 <- page1 |> html_nodes(".ipc-rating-star--voteCount") |> html_text()
votes2 <- page2 |> html_nodes(".ipc-rating-star--voteCount") |> html_text()

# From ChatGPT :
votes1 <- str_replace_all(votes1, "[()]", "")
votes2 <- str_replace_all(votes2, "[()]", "")

# From ChatGPT :
votes1 <- str_remove_all(votes1, "[^0-9.K]")
votes2 <- str_remove_all(votes2, "[^0-9.K]")


votes_numeric1 <- str_remove_all(votes1, "K") |> as.numeric() * 1000
votes_numeric2 <- str_remove_all(votes2, "K") |> as.numeric() * 1000

combined_votes <- c(votes_numeric1 , votes_numeric2)
print(combined_votes)

search_film <- function(name_of_the_film) {
  result <- imdb_movies_data[imdb_movies_data$Title == name_of_the_film, ]
  return(result)
}

Visualising Data


Show code
updated_imdb_movies_data <- imdb_movies_data |> 
  group_by(Year) |>
  mutate(Mean_Rate = mean(Rate), Total_Film_Numbers = n())

plot_mean_rate_per_year_point <- ggplot(updated_imdb_movies_data, aes(x = Year, y = Mean_Rate)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_boxplot()

plot_mean_rate_per_year_point













 Back to top

title: About Me
text:
Internships

T.C. Sanayi ve Teknoloji Bakanligi, 16/08/2024 - 13/09/13

title: Hello there, I am Ahmet OZCAN!..
Assignment 1
text:
Part A

SUMMARY

After completing his undergraduate and graduate studies, Baykal Hafizoglu went to Arizona State University for his Ph. After receiving his PhD degree, he continued his career as an expert in management research in the United States. He has worked in operations research and optimization for several companies in the US and is currently working as a director of platform management for a large company. He says that university courses provide students with useful foundational knowledge in analytics. For example, a statistics course teaches diagnostic analysis through hypothesis testing, while regression forecasting provides an introduction to predictive analysis. He talks about optimization projects he has carried out in the past in various industries. These projects have been in areas such as supply chain management, cost optimization and pricing. Students are advised to develop their mathematical modeling and coding skills, as well as learn about data structures and basic algorithms in programming languages such as Python. It emphasizes the importance of being prepared for potential questions in recruitment processes and the ability to effectively define a project from start to finish. Drawing attention to the business opportunities in analytics and optimization in Turkey, he points out that these sectors are developing rapidly and that small businesses in particular need to learn about data science, optimization and operations research.

QUESTION - 1 : Question: Which of the following is a method used for scaling numerical data in a data set?


Averaging
Min-Max Scaling
Converting categorical data to numerical
Delete missing values in the data set


QUESTION - 2 : In the data preprocessing stage, what are two common methods used to convert categorical data into numerical values?

Answer is Label Encoding and One-Hot Encoding


Part B

I got help a website for using “sapply()” and “lapply()”. I also got a little help from gpt on the “kable()” function.
If the package does not open, install the package by (tool>install package) and try again.

library(dslabs)

Total number of NA values in the entire data set


total_of_numbers_NA <- sum(is.na(polls_us_election_2016))
total_of_numbers_NA

[1] 11604



For numeric columns, replace NA values with my birth year


numerc_columns <- sapply(polls_us_election_2016, FUN=is.numeric) 
polls_us_election_2016[numerc_columns] <- lapply(polls_us_election_2016[numerc_columns], function(x) {
  my_birthyear <- 2003
  ifelse(is.na(x), my_birthyear, x)
  })


Replace NA values with my first name for character columns.


character_col <- sapply(polls_us_election_2016, FUN=is.character)
polls_us_election_2016[character_col] <- lapply(polls_us_election_2016[character_col], function(y) {  
  my_name <- "Ahmet"
  ifelse(is.na(y), my_name, y)
  })


Replace NA values with my first name for factor columns.


factor_col <- sapply(polls_us_election_2016, FUN=is.factor)
polls_us_election_2016[factor_col] <- lapply(polls_us_election_2016[factor_col], function(z) {  
  my_name <- "Ahmet"
  z <- as.character(z) #got help from gpt on this line
  ifelse(is.na(z), my_name, z)
  })


The modified data set is stored as a new object.


new_object <- polls_us_election_2016


The first 10 rows of the new data frame and the total number of NAs remaining in the new data frame.

title: Hello there, I am Ahmet OZCAN!..
text:
Hello there, I am Ahmet OZCAN!..



Click for MyCV




Education

Industrial Engineering, Hacettepe University, Turkey, 2021 - ongoing.



Objective
I aspire to engage actively in data-driven process enhancement and optimization initiatives by leveraging my analytical and problem-solving skills within industrial engineering. My goal is to advance my expertise, particularly in data analysis, statistical quality control, and process management, while delivering innovative and efficient solutions to business operations through the technical skills I have developed. As a collaborative engineer candidate who thrives in team environments, I am dynamic and committed to lifelong learning, and I seek to contribute meaningfully to technology and data-informed decision-making processes.


Skills & Abilities

Data Analysis & Statistical Models: Data analysis using R and Excel, statistical quality control applications.
Programming & Technical Skills: R (Quarto, R Markdown), Python (basic level), SQL (basic queries)
Reporting & Presentation: Technical report writing, data visualization, dynamic report preparation with Quarto.
Project Management & Teamwork: Energy consumption analysis projects, academic project experience
Communication & Organization: Ability to work in a team, analytical thinking, problem solving skills.
Language Proficiency: Turkish (Native), English (Upper Intermediate Level)



Internships

T.C. Sanayi ve Teknoloji Bakanligi - 2024

Completed my voluntary internship in the Incentive Implementation and Foreign Capital Unit. I gained a deeper knowledge of MS Excel

YETGEN - Yetkin Gençler - 2024

I successfully finished program assignments and formulated a solution concept addressing a global challenge in line with the UN Sustainable Development Goals during the GrişGen Ideathon.


Competencies

R, Quarto, Git, Python



Hobbies

Movie and series, play computer games, reading books and travel.



Piraeus of Athens





 Back to top
